Module save¶

A module containing the Saver class, used for storing DataFrames with molecules on disk.

class npfc.save.Saver(shuffle=False, random_seed=None, chunk_size=None, encode_mols=True, col_mol='mol', col_id='idm', sep='|')[source]¶

A class for saving DataFrames with molecules to different file types.

Create a Saver object with below parameters.

Note

The reason I have a class for this is because I wanted to avoid at lot of redundant code. But a class is not that perfect if one Saver object has to instanciated everytime. As a work-around, I also added a save function using this class.

Parameters:
  • shuffle (bool) – randomize records
  • random_seed (Optional[int]) – a number for reproducing the shuffling
  • chunk_size (Optional[int]) – the maximum number of records per chunk. If this value is unset, no chunking is performed, otherwise each chunk filename gets appended with a suffix: file_XXX.ext.
  • encode_mols (bool) – convert rdkit.Chem.Mol objects to base64 string representation. For HDF format, pandas stops complaining about PerformanceWarning, for csv molecules do not need to parsed again.
  • col_mol (str) – if molecules need to be encoded, then the encoding is perfomed on this column.
save(df, output_file)[source]¶

Save the input DataFrame on disk using Saver object parameters.

Parameters:
  • df (DataFrame) – the input DataFrame
  • output_file (str) – the output file
Return type:

List[List[Union[str, int]]]
Returns:

the list of output files with their number of records
npfc.save.encode_mol(mol)[source]¶

Convert a molecule to binary and then represent this binary as base64 string.

Parameters:mol (Mol) – the input molecule
Return type:str
Returns:the molecule in base64
npfc.save.save(df, output_file, shuffle=False, random_seed=None, chunk_size=None, encode_mols=True, col_mol='mol', col_id='idm', sep='|')[source]¶

A method for saving DataFrames with molecules to different file types. This is handy way of using the Saver class without having to keep a Saver object.

Note

I did this because it was the most easiest way, I guess I’ll have to investigate class methods for a better implementation.

Parameters:
  • df (DataFrame) – the input DataFrame
  • output_file (str) – the output file
  • shuffle (bool) – randomize records
  • random_seed (Optional[int]) – a number for reproducing the shuffling
  • chunk_size (Optional[int]) – the maximum number of records per chunk. If this value is unset, no chunking is performed, otherwise each chunk filename gets appended with a suffix: file_XXX.ext.
  • encode_mols (bool) – convert rdkit.Chem.Mol objects to base64 string representation. For HDF format, pandas stops complaining about PerformanceWarning, for csv molecules do not need to parsed again.
  • col_mol (str) – if molecules need to be encoded, then the encoding is perfomed on this column.
Return type:

List[List[Union[str, int]]]
Returns:

the list of output files with their number of records
